points.name: Cape Cod & Outer Cape, USA
points.info: Seasonal corridor for great white sharks along dynamic coastal fronts at the Gulf Stream boundary.
points.environment: Shelf break, strong thermal/frontal gradients, cold–warm water mixing, seal colonies nearby.
points.ecosystem: Temperate coastal shelf and frontal zone with recurrent plankton blooms.
points.recentEvents: Recent satellite analyses show sharp frontal filaments along the shelf break that align with seal foraging areas and known white shark patrol routes.

points.name: Bimini, Bahamas
points.info: Shallow lagoon-to-slope transition in clear tropical waters; key site for juvenile development and pelagic encounters.
points.environment: Coral reef edges, mangrove nurseries, shelf-edge drop-offs, high clarity.
points.ecosystem: Coral reef–pelagic interface with nursery habitats.
points.recentEvents: Tagging work reports repeated site fidelity of lemon sharks near shelf breaks; satellite color shows seasonal clarity/productivity pulses influencing prey.

points.name: Gulf of Mexico – Mississippi Plume
points.info: Nutrient-rich river plume that fuels high productivity and supports coastal to pelagic food webs.
points.environment: Turbid brackish plume over the shelf; hypoxia risk in summer; strong river discharge variability.
points.ecosystem: Estuarine–shelf mixing zone transitioning to open Gulf pelagic waters.
points.recentEvents: Pulse-like chlorophyll spikes after heavy rainfall events have coincided with increased juvenile shark use of inshore habitats.
measurements: Mesoscale fronts & eddies at plume edge (SWOT)

points.name: Revillagigedo Archipelago, Mexico
points.info: Remote oceanic islands with upwelling and eddies that aggregate prey and apex predators.
points.environment: Island wakes, open-ocean drop-offs, eddy corridors, volcanic seamounts.
points.ecosystem: Pelagic island hotspot with transient fronts.
points.recentEvents: Altimetry maps show persistent eddy tracks and convergences around the seamounts that match shark movement corridors.

points.name: Galápagos Islands, Ecuador
points.info: Convergence of Humboldt and Equatorial currents creates recurrent nutrient pulses and predator hotspots.
points.environment: Equatorial upwelling, island wakes, current bifurcations and jets.
points.ecosystem: Equatorial pelagic hotspot with reef/island margins.
points.recentEvents: Fronts and eddy injections detected in altimetry align with seasonal schooling of hammerheads near island platforms.

points.name: Cocos Island, Costa Rica
points.info: Key stepping-stone in the Eastern Tropical Pacific hammerhead migration corridor.
points.environment: Oceanic seamount/reef, strong currents, thermocline uplift.
points.ecosystem: Oceanic reef with pelagic convergence features.
points.recentEvents: Mesoscale convergence lines mapped from altimetry coincide with seasonal aggregations of schooling hammerheads.

points.name: Great Barrier Reef, Australia
points.info: Vast reef system with outer-shelf drop-offs that concentrate prey and serve as nurseries.
points.environment: Outer reef slopes, shelf-edge currents, river plume influence inshore.
points.ecosystem: Coral reef platform transitioning to pelagic slope.
points.recentEvents: Seasonal river plumes and boundary currents highlighted by ocean color and altimetry have coincided with peaks in reef-predator activity.
measurements: Reef water optical properties & phytoplankton groups (PACE)

points.name: Ningaloo Reef, Western Australia
points.info: Fringing reef along the Leeuwin Current with seasonal whale shark and tiger shark aggregations.
points.environment: Reef–ocean exchange, boundary current intrusions, lagoon flushing.
points.ecosystem: Coral reef along a western boundary current.
points.recentEvents: Ocean-color indices show seasonal productivity pulses linked to whale shark sightings; altimetry reveals current intrusions onto the shelf.

points.name: Raja Ampat, Indonesia
points.info: Global biodiversity hotspot with strong tidal mixing and narrow channels that funnel prey.
points.environment: Complex archipelago passages, sills, and internal tides.
points.ecosystem: Coral reef archipelago with intense exchange between lagoons and open ocean.
points.recentEvents: Altimetric signals of channel flow and tidal convergence correspond to localized peaks in reef predator activity.

points.name: Palau, Western Pacific
points.info: Oceanic reef chain influenced by mesoscale fronts and rich coral ecosystems.
points.environment: Pass channels, outer reef walls, mesoscale convergence.
points.ecosystem: Coral reef–pelagic interface with strong pass-exchange.
points.recentEvents: Surface convergence lines and frontal gradients have been repeatedly observed, coinciding with tuna and shark foraging.

points.name: Fiji – Beqa / Viti Levu
points.info: Reef platforms affected by strong coastal currents and freshwater inputs, driving high productivity.
points.environment: Reef passes, shelf breaks, occasional river plumes.
points.ecosystem: Tropical coral reef platforms transitioning to pelagic slopes.
points.recentEvents: Ocean color reveals intermittent plume influence enhancing coastal productivity and predator presence.

points.name: False Bay, South Africa
points.info: Benguela upwelling region with pinniped colonies; historically important great white habitat.
points.environment: Cold, nutrient-rich upwelling filaments and shelf fronts; seal and penguin colonies.
points.ecosystem: Temperate eastern boundary upwelling system (Benguela).
points.recentEvents: Filamentary upwelling and frontal lines highlighted in satellite data co-occur with peaks in forage fish abundance and shark activity.

points.name: Mozambique Channel
points.info: Eddy-rich corridor transporting nutrients and prey along the channel.
points.environment: Strong mesoscale eddies and jets, shelf canyons, island wakes.
points.ecosystem: Subtropical channel with eddy-driven productivity.
points.recentEvents: Altimetry shows eddy trains moving southward; eddy-induced chlorophyll anomalies link to pelagic predator foraging.

points.name: Red Sea – Brothers / Daedalus
points.info: Offshore coral reefs known for frequent oceanic whitetip encounters.
points.environment: Steep reef walls, open-sea exposure, strong seasonal stratification.
points.ecosystem: Oligotrophic coral reef in a semi-enclosed sea.
points.recentEvents: Surface convergence lines detected by altimetry align with baitfish aggregations reported by divers.

points.name: Socotra, Arabian Sea
points.info: Monsoon-driven upwelling hotspot that boosts productivity and pelagic predator presence.
points.environment: Seasonal upwelling jets, strong winds, filaments along the coast and island.
points.ecosystem: Monsoon upwelling system with coastal–ocean exchange.
points.recentEvents: Ocean color shows monsoon bloom onset followed by frontal sharpening; altimetry highlights coastal jets and filaments.

points.name: Senegal, West Africa
points.info: Intense fishing zone along an upwelling margin with high coastal shark diversity.
points.environment: Canary Current influence, coastal upwelling, river inputs, sandy shelves.
points.ecosystem: Eastern boundary upwelling margin.
points.recentEvents: Upwelling filaments observed along the shelf coincide with enhanced chlorophyll and small pelagic fish schools.

points.name: Japan Coast
points.info: Migration zone for blue and mako sharks influenced by Kuroshio meanders and rings.
points.environment: Western boundary current, strong eddies, shelf–slope exchange.
points.ecosystem: Temperate boundary current system with frontal habitats.
points.recentEvents: Altimetry shows Kuroshio path shifts and ring spawning events that coincide with pelagic predator movements.

points.name: Maldives, Central Indian Ocean
points.info: Atoll nation with channels that focus currents and plankton, supporting sharks and manta rays.
points.environment: Atoll passes, monsoon-driven flow reversals, lagoon–ocean exchange.
points.ecosystem: Tropical coral atoll systems with pelagic inflow.
points.recentEvents: Seasonal color signals indicate plankton pulses during monsoon transitions; whale shark sightings track these pulses.

points.name: East Coast of Australia
points.info: Coastal migration corridor for juvenile great white sharks and other temperate pelagics.
points.environment: EAC (East Australian Current) eddies and shelf-edge fronts; beach embayments and headlands.
points.ecosystem: Temperate western boundary current shelf system.
points.recentEvents: Altimetry highlights EAC eddy arrivals at the shelf edge that intensify frontal structure and prey transport inshore.
measurements: Optical water mass typing & phytoplankton groups (PACE)

points.name: South Coast of Australia
points.info: Temperate waters with frequent great white sightings near islands and shelf breaks.
points.environment: Shelf canyons, rocky islands, upwelling patches, strong wind-driven mixing.
points.ecosystem: Temperate shelf and island systems with seasonal upwelling.
points.recentEvents: Satellite color shows episodic upwelling and bloom events; altimetry indicates along-shelf jets that enhance prey transport.
